error.signature: MaxListenersExceededWarning: Possible EventEmitter memory leak detected. 11 listeners added

verdict.summary: Too many event listeners on one emitter. Usually forgetting to remove listeners.

dead_ends.why_fails: Hides the memory leak â€” listeners accumulate without bound
The leak will grow until the process runs out of memory

workarounds.action: Remove listeners when done: emitter.removeListener() or emitter.off()
Use { once: true } for one-time listeners: emitter.on('event', fn, { once: true })
workarounds.how: true } for one-time listeners: emitter.on('event', fn, { once: true })

workarounds.action: Check for listeners added in loops or repeated function calls
workarounds.how: Check for listeners added in loops or repeated function calls

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'MaxListenersExceededWarning' is a memory_warning error while 'AbortError' has a different failure mode despite similar symptoms. Check error message details to differentiate.
